conclusion: Analyze the motion of the frame as it moves through the magnetic field to determine the time of induced current.
The square conductor frame has a side length of l, the magnetic field has a width d, the frame moves with a constant speed v, and l < d.
An induced current is generated when there is a change in magnetic flux through the frame, occurring when any part of the frame is within the magnetic field.
The frame starts moving from outside the magnetic field.
The front edge of the frame enters the magnetic field first.
The frame will be completely inside the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance l into the field.
The frame will start exiting the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d.
The frame will be completely outside the magnetic field when the front edge has moved a distance d + l.
Entry time is the time taken for the front edge of the frame to move from the start of the magnetic field to being completely inside, which is l/v.
Full inside time is the time during which the frame is completely inside the magnetic field, from when the front edge is at l to when it is at d, which is (d - l)/v.
Exit time is the time taken for the frame to move from being completely inside to completely outside, which is again l/v.
The total time during which there is an induced current is the sum of the entry time, full inside time, and exit time, which is (d + l)/v.
The time during which there is an induced current in the frame is (d + l)/v.
